definition: (old) (esp. of the Emperor) to show special favor towards

sentences.english: A boy he rutted with once too often returned the favor.
sentences.chinese: 一個他曾經那麼寵幸的男孩給了他絕妙的回報。

sentences.english: The president, however, remains supportive of a cherished member of his cabinet.
sentences.chinese: 不過，總統依然支持着這位受其寵幸的內閣成員。
她以阿諛奉承博得寵幸。

sentences.english: And thou shalt find grace and good understanding before God and men.
sentences.chinese: 這樣，你在天主和世人面前，必獲得寵幸和恩愛。

sentences.english: Easy to indulge in sweet talk.
sentences.chinese: 喜歡被寵幸，容易沉迷甜言蜜語。

sentences.english: No woman wants to be loved just by lucks.
sentences.chinese: 女人不想要只有寵幸的愛。
